articles.headline: Luxe Hotels in a Battle for Control
articles.snippet: Owners of luxury hotels, facing debt payments, may want their operators to raise revenue by cutting room rates — a move operators resist because it cheapens the brand.
articles.abstract: Owners of luxury hotels, facing debt payments, may want their operators to raise revenue by cutting room rates — a move operators resist because it cheapens the brand.
articles.lead_paragraph: It is not often that luxury hotel owners find themselves locked out of their own properties, but that is what the lawyers for owners say has happened at the Four Seasons Resort Aviara, north of San Diego.

articles.headline: Lawyer to Stars’ Ex-Wives Has Never Been Busier
articles.snippet: In Britain, divorcing wives are increasingly turning to Raymond Tooth.
articles.abstract: In Britain, divorcing wives are increasingly turning to Raymond Tooth.
articles.lead_paragraph: LONDON  A Mr. Tooth on the phone for you, sir.

articles.headline: Bankruptcy for G.M. Would Tax the Experts
articles.snippet: Many, many lawyers are preparing to take their seats as General Motors plans its path toward bankruptcy.
articles.abstract: Many, many lawyers are preparing to take their seats as General Motors plans its path toward bankruptcy.
articles.lead_paragraph: DETROIT  The decline of General Motors may be putting thousands of auto workers and managers out of work, but it will be putting a lot of lawyers to work.
articles.byline: By Micheline Maynard and Michael J. de la Merced

articles.headline: Localities Want U.S. to Support Muni Bonds
articles.snippet: Cash-strapped state and local governments are seeking help from the federal government to make their bonds look safer in a difficult credit market.
articles.abstract: Cash-strapped state and local governments are seeking help from the federal government to make their bonds look safer in a difficult credit market.
articles.lead_paragraph: State and local governments are asking Washington to give them something that banks are trying to get rid of: federal bailout money.

articles.headline: Europe Feels the Strain of Protecting Workers and Plants
articles.snippet: As Europe refuses to reduce the ranks of its auto workers, its carmakers risk falling behind in the current wave of global consolidation that is transforming the industry.
articles.abstract: As Europe refuses to reduce the ranks of its auto workers, its carmakers risk falling behind in the current wave of global consolidation that is transforming the industry.
articles.lead_paragraph: RÜSSELSHEIM, Germany  For Klaus Franz, the top union official at General Motors’ Opel unit here, the difference between how the United States and Europe confront the auto industry’s global overcapacity problem is simple.

articles.headline: Obama Hails Judge as ‘Inspiring’
articles.snippet: If confirmed, Sonia Sotomayor would probably not change the court’s broad philosophical balance.
articles.abstract: If confirmed, Sonia Sotomayor would probably not change the court’s broad philosophical balance.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON  President Obama announced Tuesday that he would nominate Sonia Sotomayor, a federal appeals judge in New York, to the Supreme Court, choosing a daughter of Puerto Rican parents who was raised in a Bronx public housing project to become the nation’s first Hispanic justice.
articles.byline: By Peter Baker and Jeff Zeleny
